titles.title: Dating Guru
titles.description: You're a true dating expert with deep insights into modern relationships!

titles.title: Romantic Expert
titles.description: You have great dating knowledge and a healthy perspective on relationships!

titles.title: Hopeful Romantic
titles.description: You're on the right track with a good understanding of dating dynamics!

titles.title: Casual Dater
titles.description: You have some dating experience but there's room to grow!

titles.title: Dating Newbie
titles.description: Everyone starts somewhere! Use these tips to improve your dating knowledge.

1: Try to be more open to different types of people. Opposites can complement each other!
Don't put too much pressure on first impressions. Give people a chance to show their true selves.
Consider that there might be many potential matches, not just one 'perfect' person.
Remember that love at first sight is rare - deep connections often take time to develop.
Be open to meeting people outside your usual 'type' - you might be surprised!
2: Try updating your profile with recent photos that show your personality.
Be honest in your profile to attract compatible matches.
Don't judge potential matches too quickly based on their profile alone.
Consider that people may present differently online than in person.
Remember that online chemistry doesn't always translate to in-person chemistry.
3: Be open about your expectations early in the relationship.
Remember that healthy relationships involve compromise from both sides.
Consider that love languages might differ between partners.
Communicate your needs clearly instead of expecting your partner to guess.
Understand that relationships require effort from both people to succeed.
4: Practice active listening in your conversations.
Try to express your needs clearly and calmly.
Remember that it's okay to take time to process your thoughts before responding.
Avoid making assumptions - ask for clarification when needed.
Use 'I' statements to express how you feel without blaming your partner.
5: Be open about your long-term goals early in the relationship.
Remember that commitment levels can grow over time.
Consider what you truly want from a long-term partnership.
Discuss important topics like marriage and children when the relationship becomes serious.
Understand that people's goals and priorities can change over time.

defaultTips: Be yourself and have fun getting to know new people!
Remember that every relationship is a learning experience.
Stay open to new experiences and perspectives.
Trust your instincts when something doesn't feel right.
Don't be too hard on yourself - dating can be challenging for everyone.
